reviews.text: 64546 Mörfelden-Walldord
reviews.title: convenient/good price for airport hotel

reviews.text: Date: June 21, 2006
reviews.title: Bad experiences - avoid this one!

reviews.text: Reviewer: A TripAdvisor member from Boston, MA.
reviews.title: Great Deal!

reviews.text: When I looked at reviews online, I did not see a bad one so I booked at the hotel. In fact there was only one, I wish these others had spoken up earlier before the stay. I sent two email messages to book a hotel, but none was returned.
reviews.title: Unhelpful staff, misleading information
Beware
reviews.text: My wife stayed and arrived in the evening, and was leaving in the morning. She only needed a clean place to stay, and a shuttle to the airport. The times were specifically stated in the two emails, not returned and on the phone arriving in the airport.

The ride to the airport was over 30 minutes, the only thing I can think is the distance listed was the distance a bird flies and not the actual driving distance or it was the distance from a portion of the airport but not the distance from where a person actually gets a ride to the airport.
reviews.title: A good airport hotel, but watch for what you’re charged.

reviews.text: Once she arrived, because my wife had a morning flight, was informed that there would be no breakfast because she was leaving too early and no taxi because she was leaving too early. This is an airport hotel whoose shuttle does not match normal check in times for catching a morning flight. She was offered a ride back to the airport, but it was gettting so late that there would be no chance for sleep.
reviews.title: I will not stay at this hotel again
I'll be back!
reviews.text: The hotel staff told her the trip to the airport would cost 18euros, when it actually cost over 30euros. When you add in the cost of the taxi and breakfast this hotel was no longer a bargin. When asked why they did not tell her any of this information before arriving, the person at the front desk just gave a dumb look and did not answer.

Apparently, this hotel is a favorite for Lufthansa when they have to provide accommodation for passengers due to flight delays. And that's how I came to stay here for a night. On the whole, it's a disappointment. The exterior and lobby suggest something upscale, but that's definitely not what you are in for: Lufthansa provided a voucher for a "20 euro" dinner at the hotel, which consisted of a buffet where you could get chicken (no one was really sure what it was) that tasted like cardboard and rice that tasted like, um, cardboard. There is a bar in the hotel that presumably offers more selections, but the beer consisted of Pilsner and Weiss, That's it. No lager (yes, I know that Pilsner is a type of lager), no IPA, no porter, no...
reviews.title: Not worth the trouble to stay here unless the airline is paying

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And what about the room? Despite the nice lobby, the room was a weird, 19th century space-time warp. Very cramped, lots of mahogany trim, an upholstered bench (??) near the bed: the whole thing looked like a second-class cabin on the Titanic.
reviews.title: Great value for money for an airport hotel

reviews.text: At least the breakfast buffet was more than adequate.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Skip this place unless you have to stay here.
reviews.title: You can do better

reviews.text: The room is clean, comfortable, sufficiently large and well decorated. I was very positively surprised for an airport hotel. €80 per nite is good value for money too. I'll definitely stay here again if I've to sleep close to Frankfurt airport.
reviews.title: Good choice for the Airport
Not the most accommodating
reviews.text: I am at the hotel right now and primarily because I had to spend a night in Frankfurt in transit. As someone else wrote, this hotel is supposed to be close to the airport (the reason I chose it) but it´s out in the woods. The hotel does offer a free shuttle service to and from the airport. However, be aware that the service from the airport stops at 10:45 PM and if your flight arrives after that time (as mine did, due to weather) you are on your own. Be further advised that a cab ride from the airport to the hotel runs 20 Euros!

For a full Holiday Inn the accommodations here is sub-par. In my room there is no radio clock, no shoe-shine kit, no sewing kit, etc. Everything comes with a high cost (4.5 Euros for 45 minutes of Internet access, 5 Euros for a bottle of water, etc.) and because you have no alternative you have to pay what they ask.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good if you have a car to return

reviews.text: On the plus side, the room is clean and the shower is good, and the breakfast buffet is very good. But I am paying dearly for a 14 hour stay.
reviews.title: Stay away or get food poisoning
Bad
reviews.text: This hotel is much better on the inside than the outside appearance. The rooms are trimmed in nice wood and are larger than most European Hotels. I actually had a king size bed, not 2 twins pushed together!
The hotel is about 10km from the airport, which makes the time between shuttles long. The bus is small, but I had a car to return, so this was not an issue.
reviews.title: Too far away from the airport

reviews.text: I am a Platinum priority club member so you can imagine that I have stayed at many Holiday Inn chains and was shocked to get the worst service at this Holiday Inn hotel. The staff here (especially the person named S. Nadesan) needs to learn basic etiquette on how to greet their Platinum members/customers. I and my wife went to talk to the front desk with their shuttle service issue. The issue being apart (which never got resolved), he started arguing and talking very impolitely with us. When we commented that "the staff here is very rude" to which he repiled "YES". Whatever the issue may be it can always be dealt with profressionally but this guy was not even close be being professional.
reviews.title: Hotel with RUDE staff

reviews.text: I would definitely NOT recommended this hotel to anyone. Holiday Inn has a standard in US and Europe market but with staff members and service like this they will not only lose their standards but also their regular customers.
reviews.title: Convenient and affordable airport accommodations - good food and a great bed

reviews.text: I had a 1 night layover in Frankfurt on my way home from Eastern Europe. It was a long business trip, and I needed to rest. This hotel, nestled in the woods (from what I could tell as I came in and did not leave), was a perfect refuge. The staff was extremely friendly, the internet worked perfectly, the bed was great - in all, I got my work done, filled my belly with good food and wine, and slept like a baby. This was the perfect solution to my needs!
reviews.title: Perfect all inclusive package

reviews.text: Organisation, Service, Accomodation, Meeting facilities and catering were absolutely fabulous. Especially the ladies we were working with at the banquet bureau have been super organised and very helpful in any case. Very friendly, professional and flexibel personnel at this place, which is absolutely recommendable for any kind of meetings, events or trainings, as well as simply being guest in that very nice hotel.
reviews.title: Very old hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you very much!
reviews.title: Find another place

reviews.text: Based on Tripadvisor reviews of this hotel and others closer to the airport, I chose this hotel. I had to stay in Frankfurt overnight in order to get an early morning connection. Otherwise, I would have stayed nearer the city center. The hotel is a isolated, so unless you have a car, you will need to take a taxi to an area where there are restuarants and more things to do. The staff is very cordial, but the hotel is average at best and does need interior updating. The room wasn't very cool and I wasn't sure if the AC was disfunctional or just undersized as cool area did blow from it. The lobby was quite warm when I checked in, as well, so they may have been having problems. Since I was only in the room a few hours, I lived with the conditions.
reviews.title: Average Place, Decent Location for Overnight Stay

reviews.text: There is a free airport shuttle, but you need to contact the hotel when you arrive to determine where it is at on the dropoff/pickup schedule, as well as the pickup location. There are no signs and if it has left the airport, you will have to wait about 30 minutes for it to return or take a taxi (approx. 20 Euros). You also need to get your name on the list when you leave the hotel as the van may only sit 9-10 people, so plan accordingly.
reviews.title: Convinient for airport transfer, needs renovation

reviews.text: The staff recommended the Sachsenhausen area to watch Germany play in the 3rd place game for the 2010 World Cup. A good recommendation and good area with lots of bars. Taxi fare ranged from 13 - 18 Euro one way.
reviews.title: Great location for fantastic price

reviews.text: I stayed at the airport Holiday Inn in march on my way back from Stuttgart and this hotel is very convinient as a transfer hotel, but the rooms and the rest of hotel need renovation. The breakfast buffet was fine, however the rooms are very small and not very clean.
reviews.title: great value. friendly staff

reviews.text: I enjoyed stay at this hotel as well, as free transfer to and from airport. I liked very much the service, location and personal in this place. I, however, find this hotel more suitable for business rather than for holiday traveller. In any case, I enjoyed everything including very good breakfast! In my case the price was also fantastic!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Perfect Stay

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel twice during October, 7-8th and 23-25th. The service at this hotel from the front desk to the restaurant and bar was first rate! Although I failed to request early check-in, the front desk easily accommodated my early arrival. Because I joined the Priority Club (for free), I was able to request late check-out on the last day of my second stay.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The room was excellent. Very clean and very quiet. I liked the fact that it was away from the airport (I didn't hear any of the air traffic as I normally do at hotels near airports). The hotel offers a choice of restaurant dining or bar dining--I opted for the bar since I wasn't extremely hungry. HAH! The "giant burger" was wonderful and very, very filling. So good, in fact, that on the return leg I ordered the "giant chicken burger" which was equally good. Service in the bar was excellent and the staff friendly. I was hardly able to finish half of my drink before they offered a refill. I only ate in the restaurant at breakfast (I missed this on my first leg due to early departure). I was sorry I did, but I made up for it by eating a very large breakfast on my second stay. Excellent choices and, surprisingly, everything on the buffet that was supposed to be hot was! So many places have trouble doing that.
reviews.title: Good hotel but not very nice location

reviews.text: This hotel is very good, the room is nice, the staff is great but you need to get here by car, if you don't have one it is not very good, because the hotel is not so close to the city and the taxis are expensive, so if you plan to stay here and go to the city is not a very good one, unless you have your own car. I spent a lot of my money in taxis, but other than that the hotel is great!
reviews.title: Shuttle service too infrequent but good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shuttle service is only every half hour so if you just come off a long flight you may be in for a long wait. The hotel is a good 15min drive from the hotel. They need to increase the frequency of the shuttle bus to every 15 minutes. If they did that, this hotel would be much more recommendable. The rates here are lower than the Steigenberger and Sheraton. So if cost is your priority this is a good bet. But if quick access to and from the airport is your priority the Sheraton or Steigenberger may be better. The rooms are a little dated but comfortable. My non smoking room had a bit of a smoking smell. Restaurant is pricey but surprisingly good. Fitness center is closed on weekends.
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay if you are Driving

reviews.text: We started our 8 weeks in central Europe at Frankfurt, and chose this hotel because we could catch a fee shuttle bus from the airport (and use the shuttle bus and underground to get back into Frankfurt central), plus pick up our lease car (office for Renault and Peugeot leasing is in this hotel). The room was very pleasant, breakfast was good, and although dinner was not offered, a good Italian (with potato) restaurant was just a short walk down the road. Being outside of Frankfurt presented no problems about getting into central Frankfurt, but its proximity to major road systems meant heading off with our new vehicle was no problem at all. Good value.
reviews.title: Convenient with great service!
A must for a frankfurt stopover!!!!
reviews.text: Wow, we had to overnight in frankfurt on our way to dubai and i found this hotel on the net for €23.00 for the double room. i knew the hotel was near a forest and about 15mins from the airport but for €23 i wasn't sure what to expect.

reviews.title: So Great, I Felt Guilty!
reviews.text: when we arrived in frankfurt the holiday inn shuttle bus was there to bring us to the hotel. when we went into our room i was amazed at how nice the room was. it was large, clean, really nicely decorated with a great view of the beer garden.

description: Frankfurt a city well-known as finance and service centre in the middle of Germany. The airport, the stock exchange and international fairs make the pulse of the city beat faster. Surrounded by the areas Rheingau, Taunus and the southern region of the land Hessen. Sports fans also get their fair share. The recently opened Commerzbank-Arena is the heart of many football and soccer games. The Holiday Inn Frankfurt Airport-North is situated in the south of Frankfurt between the city and the airport a green spot, yet perfectly located to reach the city centre, motorways, the airport and BÃ¼rostadt Niederrad, where many office buildings are situated. Between 5:00 a.m. and 10:45 p.m. our cost-free shuttle service, on request and subject to availability, takes you to and collects you from the airport. Enjoy a fresh tapped beer and delicious grilled food in our beer garden. With nearly 300 rooms and a capacity to organize events for up to 450 people, the first-class hotel is well suited for business trips as well as for big conferences. Your car is also cared for on the big parking space. No matter whether you need a high-speed Internet access in your room or would like to check your e-mails by wireless LAN in the public areas of the hotel, here it is possible.
